meanings.definition: To view or present in a romantic way
meanings.sent1: She enjoys romanticizing old love letters she finds in the attic.
meanings.sent2: Stop romanticizing the past and focus on the present.
meanings.sent3: He was romanticizing the idea of a perfect vacation on a deserted island.
meanings.sent4: Her paintings have a way of romanticizing even the simplest scenes.
meanings.sent5: The movie did a great job romanticizing the historical events.

meanings.definition: To make something seem more attractive or idealized than it really is
meanings.sent1: The advertisement was romanticizing the benefits of the new product.
meanings.sent2: She was romanticizing the idea of living in a big city.
meanings.sent3: He kept romanticizing the idea of a dream job that didn't exist.
meanings.sent4: The book was romanticizing the struggles of the main character.
meanings.sent5: The reality show was romanticizing the challenges of starting a business.
